articles.author: Valerie Insinna
articles.description: Boeing's (BA.N) defense business is proving harder to turn around than executives initially predicted, with supplier errors and high manufacturing costs contributing to $1.7 billion in losses this year on programs like the next Air Force One and NASA's Starliner capsule.
articles.title: Focus: Boeing struggles to steer defense unit in another year of billion-dollar losses

articles.author: Tatiana Bautzer, Lananh Nguyen
articles.description: Major Wall Street firms said a dismal year of dealmaking appears to have hit a trough, and now some companies are looking to merge, offering hope that investment banking revenues could pick up after a disappointing third quarter.
articles.title: Analysis: US investment banks see early signs of revival in dealmaking

articles.author: Leika Kihara
articles.description: The Bank of Japan will face growing pressure at its policy meeting next week to shift further away from its controversial bond yield control, amid rising global bond yields and persistent inflation.
articles.title: BOJ meets as rising global yields, inflation test yield cap

articles.author: Iain Withers
articles.description: British watchdog the Financial Conduct Authority said on Friday that it had identified potential "regulatory breaches" in NatWest's handling of a decision to close former Brexit party leader Nigel Farage's accounts.
articles.title: UK watchdog finds potential NatWest 'regulatory breaches' in Farage fiasco

articles.author: Maria Martinez
articles.description: At machine parts producer S&D Blech, the head of the grinding unit is retiring. With Germany's acute labour shortage leaving few candidates to take on the skilled but dirty and hazardous manual work, the company will replace him with a robot.
articles.title: As baby boomers retire, German businesses turn to robots

articles.author: David Gaffen, Manas Mishra
articles.description: Healthcare companies who profit from treating obese and overweight patients are trying to convince investors that powerful new weight-loss drugs won't shrink their businesses.
articles.title: Analysis: Healthcare companies counter investor worries over Wegovy effect

articles.author: Sarah Wu
articles.description: Taiwan's chip industry is ready to work with the government to achieve its 2050 net-zero goal but development of new energy sources needs to be hastened as demand for artificial intelligence booms, a top industry executive said on Friday.
articles.title: Taiwan chip industry pushes government to speed up renewables

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel said on Friday military raids into Gaza were preparing "the next stage of the operation", amid fears that a ground invasion of the Palestinian enclave could spark a wider conflict and a media report of a missile hitting an Egyptian border town.
articles.title: Israeli military raid Gaza to prepare 'next stage'; report missile hit Egyptian town

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Tom Perry
articles.description: With an economy in ruins and a crumbling state, Lebanon can ill afford another war between Hezbollah and Israel.
articles.title: Broken Lebanon cannot afford war, and Hezbollah knows it

articles.author: Gabriella Borter
articles.description: Police in Maine extended their round-the-clock search for suspected Lewiston mass shooter Robert R. Card into the early hours of Friday morning, as the U.S. Army reservist eluded a manhunt following the bar and bowling alley massacres that killed 18 people and wounded 13 more.
articles.title: Maine manhunt for Lewiston mass shooter extends to another night
